Can't really see any pattern as to why this happens. If I start a new session then the toolbar reappears. However, if I restore a session, or I reopen tabs from a session that has lost the bookmarks toolbar, then it goes missing on the new session aswell.
I have checked that this isn't due to the way I have customised firefox.
Reproducible: Sometimes
Steps to Reproduce: No idea, seems random Actual Results: bookmarks toolbar disappears
Expected Results: not lost the toolbar
Maybe you have some add-on badly interacting with the browser, try in safe mode plase: http://support.mozilla.com/kb/Safe+Mode when it disappears is the full bookmarks toolbar or only its contents?
And, how did you customize firefox? did you move bookmarks from their toolbar to a new position?
I only have my bookmarks on the bookmarks toolbar. It is in its original position but I have disabled tabs on top. I have noticed that it tends to disappear when I open a link in a new window.

I experienced this on Windows 7 x64 with 4.0.
1) I moved the home button from the right side to the left of the location field. 2) After closing the toolbar editor, all my toolbars were appearing, including those I had unchecked like Google toolbar. 3) I restarted, and after that no toolbars appeared at all. 4) I went into options and reset toolbars to default, then moved the home button again and everything is fine.
@Mike, that looks like a localstore.rdf corruption, doubt we can do much for that.
